module.configure:
case "${SB_SYSTYPE}" in *-aix*) CC=xlc CFLAGS="-O2 -qmaxmem=-1 -qarch=com" LDFLAGS="-Wl,-brtl -Wl,-blibpath:/usr/lib:/lib" CC_LD_RT="-Wl,-blibpath:" ;; *-osf*) CC=cc CFLAGS="-O2 -msym -readonly_strings" CC_LD_RT="-Wl,-rpath," ;; *-hpux*) CC=cc CFLAGS="+O2 -Ae -z +Onofltacc +ESlit \ +DAportable +Oentrysched +Odataprefetch +Onolimit" CC_LD_RT="-Wl,+s -Wl,+b," ;; *-irix6*) CC=cc CFLAGS="-Wl,-woff,84 -woff 1429 -O2 -OPT:Olimit=0" CC_LD_RT="-Wl,-rpath," ;; x86_64*-linux*) LDFLAGS="-L/usr/X11R6/lib64" CC_LD_RT="-Wl,-rpath," ;; *-linux*) LDFLAGS="-L/usr/X11R6/lib" CC_LD_RT="-Wl,-rpath," ;; *-solaris2.[89]) CFLAGS="-O2 -mcpu=v8" CC_LD_RT="-R" ;; *-solaris2.5.1) CC=cc CFLAGS="-mr -Qn -xstrconst -xO1 -xtarget=generic" CPPFLAGS="-I/usr/openwin/include" LDFLAGS="-L/usr/openwin/lib" CC_LD_RT="-R" ;; *-solaris2*) CC=cc CFLAGS="-mr -Qn -xstrconst -xO1 -xtarget=generic" CC_LD_RT="-R" ;; esac
./configure CC="${CC:-gcc}" CFLAGS="${CFLAGS:--O2}" \ ${CPPFLAGS+CPPFLAGS=${CPPFLAGS}} PERL=${PERL}/bin/perl \ LDFLAGS="${CC_LD_RT}${XPM_LIB} ${LDFLAGS+${LDFLAGS}}" \ --enable-shared --enable-static --with-jpeg=${JPEG} \ --with-libfreetype=${LIBTTF} --with-xpm=${XPM} \ --with-png=${LIBPNG} --with-zlib=${ZLIB} \ --prefix=${SB_INSTALL_PREFIX}

item.para: gd.c in 2.0.14 contained an instance of declaring variables after the first line of executable code appears. This is of course not allowed by ANSI C, although many compilers accept it.
2.0.13 was available for mere minutes due to a typo in the new bounds-checking code for antialiased line drawing. Fixed.
Not all platforms -- notably msys/mingw -- have an ssize_t type. We now call an int an int in gd_jpeg.c, with good results. (Note: ssize_t is signed, unlike size_t, and it needs to be here).
The main() function of one of the test programs was accidentally included in the gd shared library, causing problems on some platforms. This has been corrected.
The antialiased drawing functions now have proper bounds checking
A void function returned a value in gd_png.c, causing warnings and, on some platforms, compilation errors but no reported runtime problems
Autohinting was being forced ON for freetype text output. This is apparently meant only for testing freetype and does not look as good as the default behavior (FT_LOAD_DEFAULT).
penf.x is properly reset when newlines are encountered in freetype text output
Search for X11 libraries on RHEL 3.0/AMD64 in /usr/X11R6/lib64
